fields.title: Web Design
fields.description: Research, plan, and improve websites and apps based on user needs.

specializations.name: UX Designer
specializations.description: Uses the full design thinking framework, designs the way a website or service flows to make it as intuitive as possible for users.

specializations.name: UI Designer
specializations.description: Focuses on making a great interface - what people see and do on a website.

specializations.name: UX Researcher
specializations.description: Understands user needs to shape a new product, and improve it through testing and iteration with users.

specializations.name: Visual Designer
specializations.description: Specializes in graphics, icons, logos, branding, animation, and other media that make a user experience compelling and unified.

milestones: Obtain a degree in Human-Computer Interaction,psychology, human factors, or similar.
Self-study specific tools not covered in the program.
Build your portfolio with 3-5 real client projects.
Network and apply for entry level jobs.
Complete a part/full time bootcamp (generally 6-18 months) to learn the processes and technical skills.
Build your portfolio with 3-5 real client projects.
Freelance to build experience.
Secure an entry level job as a Junior UX Designer, UI Designer, or Product Designer.
Obtain a post-secondary degree that includes quantitative and qualitative research.
Get 2-3 years experience doing real-world research activities.
Build 1-2 case studies.
Secure an entry level job as a UX Researcher.
Acquire some experience in professional roles with an emphasis on continuous process improvement or guest/user experience.
Build technical skills for UX specialization.
Apply Design Framework to current employment.
Get your first job as a UX Designer.

fields.title: Product Management
fields.description: Lead product strategy and execution, turning ideas into real customer solutions.

specializations.name: Product Management
specializations.description: Leads cross-functional teams to design, build & launch great products.

specializations.name: Technical Product Management
specializations.description: Aligns engineering execution with product vision and business outcomes.

specializations.name: AI / ML Product Management
specializations.description: Builds and launches intelligent, data-powered products using AI and machine learning.

specializations.name: Cloud / Infrastructure Product Management
specializations.description: Manages large-scale cloud, data, and platform products supporting global customer needs.

pathways.type: New Grad / Career Switch via Bootcamp or APM Program
milestones: Complete PM bootcamp, certification, or MBA program.
Build portfolio projects demonstrating product sense.
Network with PM mentors and alumni.
Land an APM or junior PM role to gain real-world experience.
Gain exposure to customer needs and business context.
Partner with PMs on feature scoping and trade-offs.
Lead technical project delivery and cross-functional collaboration.
Transition to PM role owning technical roadmap or APIs.
Lead product experiments (A/B testing, dashboards).
Identify metrics that define product success.
Drive prioritization using quantitative insights.
Transition into PM role focused on analytics or growth
Run experiments to improve acquisition or retention.
Learn product analytics tools and frameworks.
Partner with engineering to ship growth features.
Own end-to-end customer funnel and roadmap.

fields.title: Software Developer
fields.description: Design, program, build, deploy and maintain software using many different skills and tools.

specializations.name: Full-stack Developer
specializations.description: Builds and maintains complete software applications by handling both the front-end and back-end.

specializations.name: Mobile Developer
specializations.description: Designs, develops, tests, and maintains software applications for mobile devices like smartphone and tablets.

specializations.name: AI/ ML Engineer
specializations.description: Builds artificial intelligence systems and researches, builds and designs self-running software to automate predictive models.

specializations.name: Cloud Engineer
specializations.description: Designs, implements, manages, and maintains cloud infrastructure.

milestones: Obtain a degree from a major focused on computer science or related field.
Study foundations in algorithms, data structures, and system architecture.
Build a portfolio showcasing open-source projects, websites or applications.
Choose a niche such as front-end, back-end, cyber security.
A few months to a year of practical, project based route to becoming a software engineer.
Learn concepts such as HTML,  CSS, JavaScript, etc.
Learn through live coding sessions, project-based work, and independent study.
Build a portfolio through hands on projects.
Learn  programming fundamentals.
Build a portfolio using github to showcase your skills.
Familiarize with Git and cloud concepts.
Network and seek referrals
Choose a programming language.
Work on personal projects, hackathons, projects for individuals or businesses.
Prepare for interview process with leetcode and network.
Get certifications for target specialization.

fields.title: Content Developer
fields.description: Develop the actual content that people see on websites and print materials.

specializations.name: UX Writing / Content Design
specializations.description: Focuses exclusively on the microcopy within products (buttons, labels, error messages) to guide the user experience and improve flow conversion.

specializations.name: Technical Content Development
specializations.description: Creates highly structured, accurate, and audience-specific, content like user manuals, help guides, API documentation, and tutorials.

specializations.name: Content Strategy
specializations.description: Focuses on the “why” and “where” of content, including audits, competitive analysis, governance, and long-term content roadmaps tied to business KPIs.

specializations.name: Instructional Design
specializations.description: Designs and develops educational content, training programs, and e-learning courses, applying learning theory to complex subjects.

milestones: Obtain a Bachelor's degree in English, Communications, Journalism, or a related field.
Complete course projects and build a robust portfolio showcasing diverse content samples.
Secure an entry-level Content or Editorial internship during the last two years of study.
Transition from an adjacent field (e.g., Marketing, Teaching/L&D, Support/Customer Service).
Create a personal portfolio with 3-5 high-quality samples of your target content.
Complete specialized training (UX Writing Bootcamp, Advanced SEO course).
Start as a Developer, Engineer, or Product Manager who enjoys writing.
Apply deep subject matter expertise to write technical documentation or developer guides.
Gain proficiency in Git, Markdown, and developer documentation platforms.
Start by offering writing services to small businesses or non-profits.
Specializing in one area (B2B SaaS content or finance) to build domain expertise.
Work for a Content Marketing Agency to learn scalable production processes.
